lead_paragraph: Setting aside concerns about global warming, consumers are unloading hybrid and electric vehicles in favor of bigger cars, pickups and S.U.V.s.

headline.main: American Drivers Regain Appetite for Gas Guzzlers

snippet: Setting aside concerns about global warming, consumers are unloading hybrid and electric vehicles in favor of bigger cars, pickups and S.U.V.s.
abstract: Sales of electric and hybrid vehicles are falling in conjunction with declining fuel prices, with 75 percent of Americans who have traded in hybrid or electric car opting for all-gas replacement and sales of large trucks and SUVs spiking; experts warn of consequences for environment, with larger gas-fueled vehicles accounting for 16.2 percent of all greenhouse gases emitted in United States.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Sports Utility Vehicles and Light Trucks
